body_html:
Thanks all for sharing context and the question here. For several reasons, I don't think it makes much sense to change the file extension of Saved Model's protobuffs.

First is forwards & backwards compatibility and migrations. There are 1000s of users of SavedModel. Changing the extension would require a long period (many months) of backwards compatibility along with forward-support, such that new code could read old models. We've done such migrations in the past and they involve a large amount of work and risk (i.e. risk of outages to customers using these models and code in production settings).

Second is a general question about file extensions and suitability of them for various purposes. There are a variety of generalized proto introspection tools out there, for which it could be perfectly reasonable to open any proto and view/inspect it by an extension ".pb". At the same time, relying on the file extension ".pb" of just one file in a ML model to specify the ML platform seems problematic.
Remember that there are also weights and assets such as vocab or embedding files, that could be arbitrarily encoded as csv, proto, pbtxt, or otherwise.

In summary, I don't think it's particularly feasible to rename the saved_model.pb in the SavedModel specification, and even if we did, I don't think it will actually solve the problem at hand.

body:
Thanks all for sharing context and the question here. For several reasons, I don't think it makes much sense to change the file extension of Saved Model's protobuffs.

First is forwards & backwards compatibility and migrations. There are 1000s of users of SavedModel. Changing the extension would require a long period (many months) of backwards compatibility along with forward-support, such that new code could read old models. We've done such migrations in the past and they involve a large amount of work and risk (i.e. risk of outages to customers using these models and code in production settings).

Second is a general question about file extensions and suitability of them for various purposes. There are a variety of generalized proto introspection tools out there, for which it could be perfectly reasonable to open any proto and view/inspect it by an extension ".pb". At the same time, relying on the file extension ".pb" of just one file in a ML model to specify the ML platform seems problematic.
 Remember that there are also weights and assets such as vocab or embedding files, that could be arbitrarily encoded as csv, proto, pbtxt, or otherwise.

In summary, I don't think it's particularly feasible to rename the saved_model.pb in the SavedModel specification, and even if we did, I don't think it will actually solve the problem at hand.
